item.title: Managing Angular
item.description: Over the past couple of years, I’ve been the product lead for Angular. In this article, I’d like to share how we’ve been managing the framework. Keep in mind this content lives on my personal blog for a reason - it represents my point of view and doesn’t share a complete picture of all the processes within the team, such as people management, program management, etc. Also, that’s the second time I’m writing this article.

item.title: The Tyranny of Middle Management
item.description: Over the past two decades we’ve see nteh continual rise of the “disruptive” start-up versus the behemoth enterprise and cheered for the agility and flexibility of the “little one” while deriding the glacial pace and stodginess of old reliable colossus.
item.author: (PJ Hagerty)

item.title: Frak Lopez | I will f(l)ail at your tech interviews, here's why you should care
item.description: How technical interviews might be costing your org time and quality candidates.

item.title: Programming ZKPs: From Zero to Hero
item.description: Learn to write and modify Zero Knowledge Proofs from scratch. You'll build a digital signature scheme using hash-based commitments, gaining practical ZKP programming skills and intuition along the way. By the end, you'll have all the tools you need to implement things like group signatures.

item.title: How to Optimize Your Career for Happiness
item.description: The relentless pursuit of success often means chasing after promotions, pay raises, and prestigious titles. But what if we shifted our focus from these traditional metrics and instead optimized our careers for happiness?
item.author: (Praachi Pathak)

item.title: My Journey to Pain-Free Typing
item.description: As software developers, we type a lot. And we type very fast… This results in quite some keystrokes over the years. Sadly we don’t get younger. Due to that load most of us will feel some signs of wear and tear at some point in their career. For some it’s the neck, for others it’s a pain in the fingers.

item.title: Data driven is not the silver bullet you think it is
item.description: The big data buzzword went away a bit, but the mindset remained. These days, we call it data-driven, and it's used every day in management meetings. It's a great way to give power to your strategy, and the data doesn't lie... right?

item.title: To Nerves from Elixir
item.description: I adore Nerves. I recently joined the core team. And I'll be doing my best to help people get along with this lovely way to co-mingle hardware and massively concurrent reliable software.

item.title: Broadcasting Messages with Apache Kafka and .NET | no dogma blog
item.description: Using Kafka to broadcast a message to all instances of an application seems to be a less common use case than using Kafka to send a message to one of many instances of an application. But broadcasting is easy to do with a single change to the consumer.
